p: It was also evaluated that M. pinnata (L.) Panigrahi leaves extract (70% ethanol) having potent anti-inflammatory activity in three different models (acute, sub-acute and chronic) in both Wister rat and Swiss mice. There were no signs of gastric lesion as well as ulcerogenic activity in both acute and chronic models which draw a possible mechanism for inflammatory activity ( Pulipati et al., 2018).
